avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in the mountains after SW-snow showers and strong winds. Ongoing snow showers over the weekend further encourage wind slab and cornice formation on N- and E- aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Warming and rain last week caused most of the snow in lower elevations to melt and little snow was left in the mountains. Thursday afternoon, temperatures cooled with snow showers and now snow covers the region again. Since, wind slabs have likely formed again on N- and E-aspects and can be expected to continue forming with ongoing snowfall over the weekend.  Little snow is underneath the new snow and people traveling in the mountains should be careful of rocks underneath the wind slab.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snowpack widely became isothermal and stable in thaw on Thursday. New unstable wind slabs can form in snow showers and SW snowdrift, especially in South- and West-Iceland.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack widely became isothermal and stable in thaw on Thursday. New unstable wind slabs can form in snow showers and SW snowdrift, especially in South- and West-Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Áframhaldandi SV-éljagangur yfir helgina og hvessir á sunnudagskvöld. Á mánudag hlýnar á láglendi og rignir en líklega snjóar að mestu til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: Many avalanches, most of them small, released in the area during and after heavy but short snowfall and snowdrift on early Thursday 25 January.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh layered snow is in mountains, with thin wind slabs that can be unstable. Several small avalanches released in the area during intense but short snowfall and snowdrift on Thursday morning. Snow showers are forecasted the next few days in southerly winds.

snowpackStructure.highlights: During the last week, snow has added and drifted in variable wind. Before, there was very little snow in the area. The night before Thursday, it snowed heavily for a while, first in NE directions, then in E and SW directions. As a result, many small avalanches released in the forecast area, on slopes facing various directions. The snowpack is now layered, and thin unstable wind slabs have formed in various aspects. In the next days, continuing snow showers in SW and variable southerly winds are forecasted. Further wind slabs are expected to build up, especially on W-N-E facing slopes.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snowpack widely became isothermal and stable in thaw on Thursday. New unstable wind slabs can form in snow showers and SW snowdrift, especially in South- and West-Iceland.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack widely became isothermal and stable in thaw on Thursday. New unstable wind slabs can form in snow showers and SW snowdrift, especially in South- and West-Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg breytileg átt á sunnudag og lítil él. Hvessir á mánudag og éljar í SA, S og SV áttum. Áfram einhver éljagangur í suðlægum áttum á þriðjudag.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snowpack widely became isothermal and stable in thaw on Thursday. New unstable wind slabs can form in snow showers and SW snowdrift, especially in South- and West-Iceland.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack widely became isothermal and stable in thaw on Thursday. New unstable wind slabs can form in snow showers and SW snowdrift, especially in South- and West-Iceland.

avalancheActivity.comment: A small wet sluff released above Neskaupstaður in the thaw on Thursday.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow that has fallen since Thursday has drifted in SW winds and formed new thin wind slabs, which may be unstable. Older snow mostly became homogeneous, isothermal and stable after the thaw on Thursday. Old weak layers may though still be present in the highest mountains where the thaw had less effect.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Last week there were wind slabs on top of hardpacked snow and a weak layer with facets between. In warm weather and rain on Thursday, snow subsided and became homogeneous and isothermal up to high elevations. Temperatures went over 0°C for a time up to ca 1000 m elevation. In the highest mountains, old weaknesses may still exist. Since Thursday, a bit more snow has been added and the next few days some more should fall and drift in SW or variable southerly winds. New thin wind slabs are expected to form where snow accumulates, especially in NW-E aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: The snowpack widely became isothermal and stable in thaw on Thursday. New unstable wind slabs can form in snow showers and SW snowdrift, especially in South- and West-Iceland.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack widely became isothermal and stable in thaw on Thursday. New unstable wind slabs can form in snow showers and SW snowdrift, especially in South- and West-Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Lítilsháttar snjókoma í hægum vindi á sunnudagsmorgun, styttir svo upp og snýst í vestanátt. Hvessir með sunnanátt á mánudagskvöld, lítil snjókoma. Áfram suðlægar áttir á þriðjudag og talsverð úrkoma.
